hierarchy.entry_domain: Data Protection and Information Lifecycle Management

active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the trade-offs of enforcing strict PoLP in a large organization (e.g., reduced productivity vs. minimized blast radius). Provide real-world examples from NIST SP 800-53 or AWS Well-Architected Framework, and propose mitigation strategies like just-in-time access.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in the Least Privilege Principle (PoLP). Use the provided topic_hierarchy exactly: ['Cybersecurity', 'Security And Risk Management', 'Legal, Regulatory, and Compliance', 'Data Protection and Information Lifecycle Management', 'Access Control and Identity Management', 'Least Privilege Principle']. Core Content: - Definition: Minimum access for function only; reduces attack surface/blast radius (OWASP Open Web Application Security Project, NIST SP 800-53, AWS Well-Architected SEC03-BP02). - PoLP vs Need-to-Know: PoLP broader (systems/endpoints); Need-to-Know data-specific. - Best Practices: Granular permissions (resource/action-level), JIT access, RBAC implementation, regular audits/reviews, deny-by-default. - Steps: 1. Define roles/tasks. 2. Assign min granular perms. 3. Implement RBAC. 4. Audit. - Integration: Zero Trust, compliance. Learning Objectives (cover all): [REMEMBER: Define PoLP/terms; UNDERSTAND: Differentiate PoLP/Need-to-Know/RBAC; APPLY: Assign perms/scenarios; ANALYZE: Attack surface; EVALUATE: Assess policies; CREATE: Design policies]. Scaffolding Layers: Generate flashcards balanced across: - Layer 1 Foundation: Terms/definition. - Layer 2 Components: Differences/RBAC. - Layer 3 Implementation: Steps/examples (AWS IAM). - Layer 4 Integration: Best practices/Zero Trust/NIST.
